metadata.synopsis: Astarion at party orginized by WithersVampire LordSpawn - UnderdarkSpawn - AdventureSpawn - Did not confront Cazador

8.speaker: Astarion
8.text: And? How have our friends fared without us?
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Astarion hug [from template]

325.speaker: Player
325.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Astarion hug [from template]

187.speaker: Astarion
187.text: I'm glad. It would be so easy to go through everything we did and come out the other side bitter and twisted.
187.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Astarion hug [from template]

30.speaker: Astarion
30.text: But they deserve happiness. We all do. And I will forever be grateful to have found it with you.
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Astarion hug [from template]

189.speaker: Player
189.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Astarion hug [from template]

209.speaker: Player
209.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Astarion hug [from template]

414.speaker: Astarion
414.text: I do feel a little bad keeping you all to myself. After all, I get to see you every night.
414.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Astarion hug [from template]

69.text: I do feel a little bad keeping you all to myself. After all, I get to see you every night.
69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Astarion hug [from template]

436.speaker: Astarion
436.text: I do feel a little bad keeping you all to myself. After all, I get to see you every night.

310.speaker: Astarion
310.text: Go on, go and mingle - enjoy your time with the others. Bless them with your presence.

336.speaker: Astarion
336.text: I'll be here when you're ready. I'll always be here, my love.

279.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Astarion hug [from template]

437.speaker: Player
437.text: Do you want to come and talk to the others?

76.speaker: Astarion
76.text: Tempting, but you make a better ambassador for us than I do. I'll keep skulking here - I do it well, after all.

363.speaker: Astarion
363.text: A pity, to have gone through all that and still not found happiness.

148.speaker: Astarion
148.text: I suppose going through the kind of journey we did will leave its mark. And not everyone can be as lucky as we've been.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: It was a hell of a journey, but at least we've ended it together.

373.speaker: Astarion
373.text: I would not want it any other way.

27.speaker: Astarion
27.text: Go on, talk to the others. We have forever, after all.

48.speaker: Astarion
48.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Hells. Astarion has missed them, but supports what they're doing.

457.speaker: Astarion
457.text: I wasn't sure our withered old friend could live up to his promise, but here we are.
457.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Hells. Astarion has missed them, but supports what they're doing.

92.speaker: Astarion
92.text: And look at you! Straight from the Hells, still reeking of brimstone. I take it you've been having fun?
92.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Hells. Astarion has missed them, but supports what they're doing.

304.speaker: Player
304.text: A little. But I have missed you.
304.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Hells. Astarion has missed them, but supports what they're doing.

64.speaker: Astarion
64.text: I have missed you too. But I understand - you're where you need to be.
64.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Hells. Astarion has missed them, but supports what they're doing.

42.speaker: Astarion
42.text: And I have missed you. But I understand - our favourite fiery tiefling needed you.
42.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Hells. Astarion has missed them, but supports what they're doing.

383.speaker: Astarion
383.text: So do what you have to. You know where to find me when the mission's over.
383.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Hells. Astarion has missed them, but supports what they're doing.

333.speaker: Astarion
333.text: Understandable, but try to resist the urge. I don't want to know what your clothes have been through since we last met.

19.speaker: Astarion
19.text: Although I do like the style. 'Tortured armour' never does go out of fashion.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: You're in a good mood. Have you been drinking?

432.speaker: Astarion
432.text: Alas, no. I haven't dared to risk it while Cazador still lives.

95.speaker: Astarion
95.text: Cheeky. I've been very well behaved, thank you.

153.speaker: Astarion
153.text: Mostly well-behaved. I did have a little unfinished business.

259.speaker: Astarion
259.text: Or as well behaved as one can be while tearing through the Hells with Karlach.

285.speaker: Player
285.text: What about you? How's my favourite blood-sucker?

26.speaker: Astarion
26.text: Oh, you know, ups and downs.

196.speaker: Astarion
196.text: I haven't seen the sun since the brain fell, I'm reduced to eating vermin once more, and I can't walk the streets lest Cazador finds me...

459.speaker: Astarion
459.text: You know, when I say it out loud, there have been decidedly more downs than ups. Almost exclusively downs, actually.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I'm sorry. I wish I could have helped.

434.speaker: Astarion
434.text: Well, you've been busy, haven't you? Away having new adventures, living your new life.

350.speaker: Astarion
350.text: Although if you wanted to help now, I certainly wouldn't say no.

52.speaker: Astarion
52.text: You're more than capable of facing him. And killing him, one hopes.

270.speaker: Player
270.text: Of course, I'd be happy to kill him.

205.speaker: Astarion
205.text: Thank you. I can't tell you how much this means.

167.speaker: Astarion
167.text: But killing vampires is a decidedly day-time activity. For now, we can simply enjoy the night.

364.speaker: Player
364.text: 'One hopes'? Don't tell me you're doubting my skill?

156.speaker: Astarion
156.text: Well of course not, darling! We've all seen what you can do against a giant, floating brain - a vampire will be a walk in the graveyard after that.

416.speaker: Player
416.text: Forget it. I'm finished doing other people's dirty work.

73.speaker: Astarion
73.text: Of course, after you've saved an entire city, saving one more person is probably below you.

120.speaker: Astarion
120.text: Not that it bothers me, of course. I've always been alone - I don't see why that would change now.

302.speaker: Player
302.text: There must be something you can do?

407.speaker: Astarion
407.text: Alas, no. Since we lost our tadpoles, I'm just another vampire spawn.

41.speaker: Astarion
41.text: If he finds me, he only has to say the word and I'm his puppet again. I can't face him.

63.speaker: Astarion
63.text: You, on the other hand, are perfectly suited to facing him! And killing him, one hopes.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: That's a shame, but what'll you do.

147.speaker: Astarion
147.text: You could at least offer to help!

297.speaker: Astarion
297.text: You're more than capable of facing him - now more than ever. Killing him would be easy.

323.speaker: Astarion
323.text: Well, I had some unfinished business that I needed to take care of.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: The last time I saw you, you were running from the sun. What happened?

428.speaker: Astarion
428.text: Exactly what I feared. Without the protection of our little friends I was just an ordinary spawn again, burning in the sun. I fled the dock and found refuge in the shadows until night fell.

340.speaker: Astarion
340.text: Part of me was relieved you left so quickly after the battle. I felt... ashamed. Like I'd lost everything, just as you claimed your victory. I didn't want you to see me like that.

87.speaker: Astarion
87.text: Exactly what I feared. Without the protection of our little friends I was just an ordinary spawn again, burning in the sun. I fled the dock and found refuge in the shadows until night fell.

401.speaker: Astarion
401.text: Part of me was relieved you left so quickly after the battle. I felt... ashamed. Like I'd lost everything, just as you claimed your victory. I didn't want you to see me like that.

321.speaker: Astarion
321.text: Exactly what I feared. Without the protection of our little friends I was just an ordinary spawn again, burning in the sun. I fled the dock and found refuge in the shadows until night fell.

212.speaker: Astarion
212.text: Part of me was relieved you left so quickly after the battle. I felt... ashamed. Like I'd lost everything, just as you claimed your victory. I didn't want you to see me like that.

7.speaker: Astarion
7.text: Exactly what I feared. Without the protection of our little friends I was just an ordinary spawn again, burning in the sun. I fled the dock and found refuge in the shadows until night fell.

2.speaker: Astarion
2.text: Part of me was relieved you left so quickly after the battle. I felt... ashamed. Like I'd lost everything, just as you claimed your victory. I didn't want you to see me like that.

412.speaker: Astarion
412.text: Exactly what I feared. Without the protection of our little friends I was just an ordinary spawn again, burning in the sun. I fled the dock and found refuge in the shadows until night fell.

20.speaker: Astarion
20.text: Part of me was relieved you left so quickly after the battle. I felt... ashamed. Like I'd lost everything, just as you claimed your victory. I didn't want you to see me like that.

388.speaker: Astarion
388.text: Exactly what I feared. Without the protection of our little friends I was just an ordinary spawn again, burning in the sun. I fled the dock and found refuge in the shadows until night fell.

228.speaker: Astarion
228.text: I'm sorry I didn't seek you out that night. I felt... ashamed. Like I'd lost everything, just as you claimed your victory. I didn't want you to see me like that.

360.speaker: Astarion
360.text: And with Cazador still out there, I could hardly show my face. So I retreated to the sewers to hide, bide my time, and enjoy all the rats one can eat.

191.speaker: Astarion
191.text: But time lent perspective. It wasn't your victory, it was ours. And for all I'd lost, I had gained so much more. I had freedom, strength - a whole new life. And it was time to live it.

454.speaker: Astarion
454.text: I've been seeing the world. Rediscovering what's out there after so many years under Cazador's thumb.

263.speaker: Astarion
263.text: It turns out, it's every bit as dangerous travelling alone as it was travelling with you. I've killed more beasts and bandits than I can count.

384.speaker: Astarion
384.text: You know, it turns out I'm rather good at being a hero.

221.speaker: Player
221.text: I could have told you that.

248.speaker: Astarion
248.text: Yes, but you say all sorts of things. Honestly, I don't even listen half the time.

160.speaker: Astarion
160.text: It has made for a nice change, though - inspiring hope in people instead of terror.

70.speaker: Astarion
70.text: Well... I do try to inspire a little terror. I'm still me, after all.

214.speaker: Player
214.text: So what's next for you? Going to keep living the good life?

396.speaker: Astarion
396.text: Ha! Hardly. 'Good' people don't spend as much time lurking in the dark as I do.

319.speaker: Astarion
319.text: You know it's funny, at first I thought I was trapped by the shadows - cursed to live in them forever.

75.speaker: Astarion
75.text: But in time, I realised that darkness is as much a part of me as my fangs. This is only a curse as long as I refuse to embrace the shadows. So I decided I would.

173.speaker: Astarion
173.text: I decided not to be defined by the choices other people made - by what other people did to me. My past may be done, but my present - my future - they're mine.

427.speaker: Player
427.text: You seem... happy. Are you sure you haven't been drinking blood?

215.speaker: Astarion
215.text: No, this is all me, I swear.

411.speaker: Astarion
411.text: Don't get me wrong, I was a mess at first. Every day I yearned for the sun and mourned my curse to live in the shadows.

352.speaker: Player
352.text: Astarion: one of the good guys. Who would've thought?

112.speaker: Astarion
112.text: Let's not get carried away, darling. I'm still me.

449.speaker: Astarion
449.text: Perhaps more 'me' than I've ever been.

420.speaker: Player
420.text: Sure, as long as there's something in it for you.

166.speaker: Astarion
166.text: You do know me oh so well, don't you?

131.speaker: Astarion
131.text: But yes, there's nothing wrong with being rewarded for good work. And when it comes to killing, I do very good work.

314.speaker: Astarion
314.text: I've been exploring the world, looking for anything that will let me walk in the sun again.

367.speaker: Astarion
367.text: No joy yet, but I've killed plenty of monsters on the way.

84.speaker: Astarion
84.text: Cazador was still out there, after all. But with a little help from my new monster hunter friends, finding and destroying him barely took any effort at all.

317.speaker: Astarion
317.text: Cazador was still out there, after all. But with a little help from my new monster hunter friends, finding and destroying him barely took any effort at all.

357.speaker: Astarion
357.text: Cazador was still out there, after all. But with a little help from some friends, finding and destroying him barely took any effort at all.

269.speaker: Astarion
269.text: Cazador was still out there, after all. But with a little help from my darling love, finding and destroying him barely took any effort at all.

406.speaker: Astarion
406.text: On my part, at least. They did have to tear out his tongue before I could approach safely, but we got there in the end. And what a glorious end it was.

178.speaker: Astarion
178.text: Karlach and I have been exploring the Hells together, finding each and every infernal beast that wants to kill us.

417.speaker: Astarion
417.text: It's not exactly a 'good' time, but I can kill whatever I want and never have to worry about the sun, so... it could be worse?

344.speaker: Astarion
344.text: It has been an experience. A difficult experience.

106.speaker: Astarion
106.text: But if I could go back and make the same choices again... I think I'd still be elbow-deep in cambion guts.

141.speaker: Astarion
141.text: Some day I'll return to this plane for good, but right now I am exactly where I should be.

372.speaker: Player
372.text: It is good to see you.

394.speaker: Player
394.text: Have you found anything to help fix Karlach's engine?

224.speaker: Astarion
224.text: Perhaps, but we're trying not to get our hopes up.

306.speaker: Astarion
306.text: We found some blueprints and a map to Zariel's private forge, so if we can find a smith, and get the materials, and it's not a trap - there's a chance.

17.speaker: Astarion
17.text: But however it turns out, this isn't the last Faerûn has seen of us. Sooner or later, we will be back.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Have you ever thought about coming back to Faerûn?

133.speaker: Astarion
133.text: Without Karlach? No, this world just wouldn't be as fun.

247.speaker: Astarion
247.text: Besides, she needs me. Who else will stab one cambion while she decapitates four?

135.speaker: Astarion
135.text: I've been leading. For the first time - maybe ever - I've been thinking about people other than myself.

331.speaker: Astarion
331.text: There are thousands of vampire spawn in the Underdark - lost souls I lured into the shadows. The least I could do was give them a place they'd be safe.

29.speaker: Astarion
29.text: So I've been building a haven down there. It's relatively small for now, but growing every day as more and more spawn find us.

45.speaker: Astarion
45.text: Well of course it is, darling. That's what makes it fun.

53.speaker: Astarion
53.text: We found some ruins in the darkness and made them our own - rebuilt walls, added touches of comfort.

400.speaker: Astarion
400.text: It's no palace, but maybe someday it will be.

195.speaker: Player
195.text: Speaking of palaces, what happened to Cazador's?

376.speaker: Astarion
376.text: Oh, didn't you hear? It burned.

448.speaker: Astarion
448.text: Every sin-stained furnishing, every last trace of Cazador - it all burned.

355.speaker: Astarion
355.text: And when the structure finally gave way, it collapsed into the wretched chapel below. Every record of his infernal ritual is gone - we'll never see its like again.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: What about the spawn? How are you feeding them?

242.speaker: Astarion
242.text: Rather easily, actually. It turns out there are more than enough things willing to attack you in the Underdark.

273.speaker: Astarion
273.text: And if they find themselves on the wrong end of someone's fangs, that's on them.

274.speaker: Player
274.text: Do you ever miss walking in the sun?

284.speaker: Astarion
284.text: I did at first, but then I realised - these shadows, this darkness - it's all part of me.

288.speaker: Astarion
288.text: I spent too long defined by what other people did to me. The choices other people made for me - but that's over now.

318.speaker: Astarion
318.text: This is who I am. In all my glory, for better and for worse.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: I'm glad to hear it. Acceptance looks good on you.

303.speaker: Astarion
303.text: That being said, I haven't completely given up on returning to the sun. If the opportunity presented itself - well, I wouldn't say no...

252.speaker: Astarion
252.text: But until then, I am happy.

249.speaker: Astarion
249.text: We have had quite the journey, you and I.

368.speaker: Astarion
368.text: From the moment I first threatened you, I knew you were someone special. Someone to take on the world with.

159.speaker: Astarion
159.text: I will miss our time together. But then again, maybe this isn't goodbye so much as it's...

38.speaker: Player
38.text: More worse than better, I'd say.

28.speaker: Astarion
28.text: Then so be it. I've been through Hells metaphorical and literal, and this is what I am. I will not apologise.

418.speaker: Player
418.text: It sounds like the spawn are in good hands.

175.speaker: Astarion
175.text: They're in hands, at least. I wouldn't make a call on 'good' just yet.

241.speaker: Player
241.text: Are you worried about losing control of thousands of vampire spawn?

157.speaker: Astarion
157.text: Oh no, people can be quite meek after seeing you murder their former master.

250.speaker: Astarion
250.text: And if they do step out of line, it just takes one or two brutal examples to remind everyone else of their place.

343.speaker: Astarion
343.text: I'm not a tyrant, I do care for their well-being, I just can't afford to show weakness.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: And how are you feeding all your blood-thirsty friends?

339.speaker: Player
339.text: Aren't you worried about losing control of them?

257.speaker: Player
257.text: That sounds an awful lot like hard work.

254.speaker: Astarion
254.text: Alas, I have had to get my hands dirty.

177.speaker: Astarion
177.text: I've taken a turn as an adventurer and hero.

233.speaker: Astarion
233.text: It turns out no one actually cares about murder, as long as you murder the right people. And apparently I'm rather good at it.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I should probably go and talk to the others.

151.speaker: Astarion
151.text: Yes, no, of course - I'm very busy too.

93.speaker: Astarion
93.text: Go and mingle. I'll be here, darling, living my best life.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: It's been tough, but at least I'm there with Karlach.

385.speaker: Astarion
385.text: Yes, the right person can make just about anything bearable. And it seems like you found exactly the right person.

295.speaker: Player
295.text: Killing devils, causing chaos - I can't complain.

202.speaker: Astarion
202.text: I'd expect nothing less from someone of your talents.

108.speaker: Astarion
108.text: No, the Hells are not known for their welcoming ambience. Although if anyone can overcome them, I know you can.

342.speaker: Astarion
342.text: You always brought a whiff of madness to the battlefield. I do miss it.

6.speaker: Astarion
6.text: At least I assume it's you in there. It is a little hard to tell.

365.speaker: Astarion
365.text: How have you been since... everything?

185.speaker: Player
185.text: I have been working with the Emperor to forward our goals. You need not ask what they are.

116.speaker: Astarion
116.text: Well, that's barely ominous at all.

421.speaker: Player
421.text: The Emperor and I reformed the Knights of the Shield. It is now a formidable force.

450.speaker: Astarion
450.text: And I'm sure we're all safer for it... Probably.

266.speaker: Player
266.text: I have adjusted to my new form - come to enjoy it, even.

91.speaker: Astarion
91.text: I am glad, genuinely. Few would make the sacrifice you did.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: Acceptable, but I still think of you sometimes.

58.speaker: Astarion
58.text: I - I think of you too. I wish things could have gone differently, but...

387.speaker: Astarion
387.text: Well, no use dwelling on it, is there?

419.speaker: Player
419.text: How have you fared since we last met?

181.speaker: Player
181.text: What of you? Have you continued to drink the blood of the living?

300.speaker: Player
300.text: The last time I saw you, you were fleeing from the sun. What happened?

341.speaker: Player
341.text: I should speak to the others. Excuse me.

380.speaker: Player
380.text: I have missed our time together.

403.speaker: Astarion
403.text: Well of course you have, darling. It is not easy to replace someone like this.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I admit, it has not been easy.

145.speaker: Astarion
145.text: I am sorry, I wish things had worked out differently for you, but...

267.speaker: Astarion
267.text: I would ask if things have been going well, but you seem to be a literal god, so... I'm guessing 'yes'?

179.speaker: Astarion
179.text: What's it like? All that power at your fingertips? All those prayers to answer?

146.speaker: Player
146.text: It's been a charmed immortality so far. I'm enjoying myself immensely.

107.speaker: Astarion
107.text: There was a time when I would have done anything to have what you have. But now? I think I would have felt more chained than charmed.

335.speaker: Astarion
335.text: Don't get me wrong, I am happy for you. It's just that I'm happy for myself too.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: You seem happy. Have you been drinking?

31.speaker: Player
31.text: What about you? What have you been up to?

404.speaker: Player
404.text: I admit, there are times I miss my mortal life.

188.speaker: Astarion
188.text: Yes, I suppose you're above the baser pleasures of life now. A pity: they're often the most fun.

347.speaker: Player
347.text: Have you considered praying to me? I am the God of Ambition - I could help you.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: Oh no, I've seen what too much ambition can lead to. I'm quite all right as I am, thank you.

277.speaker: Astarion
277.text: Not that I'm immune to the charms of your domain. But all things in moderation.

389.speaker: Astarion
389.text: And here you are, in all your robes and finery.
389.context: NodeContext: The person Astarion's speaking to appears as a hologram. (Previous line: "I wasn't sure our withered friend could live up to his promise [to bring us back together], but here we are.")

392.speaker: Astarion
392.text: So, who am I looking at? Gale the teacher? Gale the hero? Gale the lover?

139.speaker: Player
139.text: Professor Gale Dekarios of Blackstaff Academy, at your service.

446.speaker: Astarion
446.text: But of course! You'll have to forgive me, I forgot to bring a shiny apple.

129.speaker: Astarion
129.text: But it is good to see you looking so comfortable in your own skin.

322.speaker: Astarion
322.text: After everything we've been through, everything we've seen, now you decide to be modest?

199.speaker: Astarion
199.text: But you always were full of surprises, weren't you?

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I'm not sure I deserve any of those titles.

356.speaker: Astarion
356.text: Ha! After everything we went through? You earned those and so much more.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I have always been 'Gale the lover', thank you.

261.speaker: Astarion
261.text: Oh, I haven't forgotten. I have vivid memories of our time together.

0.speaker: Astarion
0.text: Of course you have, darling. For mortals and gods alike.

386.speaker: Astarion
386.text: Or here I am. I'm not sure about you.
386.context: NodeContext: The person Astarion's speaking to appears as a hologram. (Previous line: "I wasn't sure our withered friend could live up to his promise [to bring us back together], but here we are.")

255.speaker: Astarion
255.text: I... I have missed you, you know.
255.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

366.speaker: Astarion
366.text: This world isn't the same without you by my side.
366.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

234.speaker: Player
234.text: I wish I could be there in person. It is good to see you.
234.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

309.speaker: Astarion
309.text: It's good to see you too. Not as good as it would be to touch you, but I'll take what I can get.
309.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

379.speaker: Player
379.text: Even with my 'condition'? I did not think you would want to be with a mind flayer.
379.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

18.speaker: Astarion
18.text: It does complicate things romantically, I can't deny that. Because as much as I'd like to pick up where we left off... I'm not sure that I can.
18.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

345.speaker: Astarion
345.text: But that doesn't mean I don't care. It doesn't mean I don't miss you.
345.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

67.speaker: Player
67.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

204.speaker: Astarion
204.text: Thank you. That... means a lot, actually.
204.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

413.speaker: Player
413.text: It matters not. These are the paths we chose - regrets will change nothing.
413.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

14.speaker: Astarion
14.text: No, that's true. We all made our choices, for better or for worse.
14.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

140.speaker: Astarion
140.text: But we can't complain too much - we both survived, after all. Despite the odds.
140.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: A pity you are not more open-minded.
143.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

44.speaker: Astarion
44.text: Even I have my limits, darling.
44.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: I'll find you once I'm done here. We can be together again - if you'd like?
158.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

369.speaker: Astarion
369.text: I'm not normally one to wait around for someone, but... well, maybe you'd be worth it.
369.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

338.speaker: Astarion
338.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

231.speaker: Player
231.text: I know, but I need to be here for Lae'zel.
231.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

324.speaker: Astarion
324.text: Of course, I don't begrudge you your choice. I just... well, wish things were different.
324.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Speaking to a romantic partner who left to fight in the Astral plane. You haven't seen them in six months.

299.speaker: Player
299.text: This is important. My people need me.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: I do not regret my choice, although I do miss your musk.

296.speaker: Astarion
296.text: And I miss your taste. I do hope we can indulge again sometime soon.

77.speaker: Astarion
77.text: Although I understand traversing a cosmic war zone is no easy thing.

240.speaker: Astarion
240.text: I've taken a breather in Limbo with Lae'zel, after myriad battles in the Astral Plane.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: I've taken a breather in Limbo with Lae'zel, after myriad battles in the Astral Plane.

264.speaker: Astarion
264.text: But of course, I imagine traversing a cosmic war zone is no easy thing.

441.speaker: Player
441.text: I've taken a breather in Limbo, after myriad battles in the Astral Plane.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I wish I could be there in person. It is good to see you.

371.speaker: Astarion
371.text: It's good to see you too. Corporeal or not.

329.speaker: Player
329.text: This projected form is adequate. Unless you missed my scent, istik?

105.speaker: Astarion
105.text: Nothing quite so carnal, I'm afraid. I'm mostly just pleased to see you alive.

438.speaker: Astarion
438.text: You know, I was concerned you'd land yourself in trouble without me to look after you. But I see you're doing just fine as you are.

61.speaker: Astarion
61.text: Flying across the cosmos on the backs of dragons, waging war on your mad queen - I couldn't be more proud.

271.speaker: Astarion
271.text: And look at you - still on our humble plane. You've practically gone native.
271.context: NodeContext: (Previous line: "I wasn't sure our withered friend could live up to his promise [to bring us back together], but here we are.")

194.speaker: Player
194.text: I stayed for love. I do not regret it.

136.speaker: Astarion
136.text: It's as fine a reason as any. And better than quite a few.

308.speaker: Player
308.text: Only partly by choice - this is a fine refuge from Vlaakith's wrath.

281.speaker: Player
281.text: I enjoyed my time in Baldur's Gate. It gave me a taste for more.

298.speaker: Player
298.text: I have come to like this planet. And even some of its people.

23.speaker: Astarion
23.text: It's more than we deserve, I assure you.

361.speaker: Astarion
361.text: Exploring this strange world, finding your place in it, dismembering the odd assassin - I couldn't be more proud.

229.speaker: Player
229.text: It's good to see you too.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: My life is in constant peril. Every day on this world could be my last.

165.speaker: Astarion
165.text: Oh, I don't doubt it. But you wouldn't want it any other way.

315.speaker: Astarion
315.text: And I hear you're doing well. Leading your church, bringing the good word of loss to all that need it - you've been busy. I was worried you might not make it tonight.
315.context: NodeContext: Speaking to Shadowheart - who's leading the church of Shar. (Previous line: "I wasn't sure our withered friend could live up to his promise [to bring us back together], but here we are.")

43.speaker: Astarion
43.text: And worried that in your devotion, you might have handed your feelings over to Shar... Worried you'd forgotten us.
43.context: NodeContext: Cautiously admitting he was genuinely worried

426.speaker: Player
426.text: My Lady demands a lot, but some things are mine.
426.context: NodeContext: Backtracking slightly. He doesn't like her THAT much. (Low approval variant of the line)

113.speaker: Astarion
113.text: I'm glad there are some limits. You can give up a lot, but lose everything and you lose yourself entirely.
113.context: NodeContext: Backtracking slightly. He doesn't like her THAT much. (Low approval variant of the line)

201.speaker: Astarion
201.text: And that would be a shame, because I've rather enjoyed our time together.
201.context: NodeContext: Backtracking slightly. He doesn't like her THAT much. (Low approval variant of the line)

164.speaker: Astarion
164.text: Well, no, not 'enjoyed' exactly. But you did grow on me over time. Like a night orchid.
164.context: NodeContext: Backtracking slightly. He doesn't like her THAT much. (Low approval variant of the line)

86.speaker: Astarion
86.text: Granted, it was a little... tense at the beginning. But once we got past the threats and the many secrets, you did grow on me. Like a night orchid.

312.speaker: Player
312.text: You're joking? I wouldn't miss this for the world.

422.speaker: Astarion
422.text: I am very glad to hear it. After all, I rather enjoyed our time together.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: No. But I would in a heartbeat, if my Lady asked it of me.

378.speaker: Astarion
378.text: A pity, I rather enjoyed our time together. Treasured it, even.

275.speaker: Astarion
275.text: And we are flourishing, by the looks of it. I've never seen you look this comfortable in your own skin.
275.context: NodeContext: stress on 'flourishing'. (Previous line: "I wasn't sure our withered friend could live up to his promise [to bring us back together], but here we are.")

225.speaker: Player
225.text: Getting to know my parents has helped. A lot.
225.context: NodeContext: A little surprised - Astarion doesn't feel like he's flourishing.

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: I can imagine. That sense of family, of connection - it can work near-literal miracles.

334.speaker: Astarion
334.text: And where better to celebrate how far you've come? An old haunt with old friends.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I've been healing. Learning. Finding my place in the world.
35.context: NodeContext: A little surprised - Astarion doesn't feel like he's flourishing.

311.speaker: Astarion
311.text: Well, look at you. You've come a long way from the scowling little Sharran I pulled a knife on.

291.speaker: Player
291.text: I could say the same about you.
291.context: NodeContext: A little surprised - Astarion doesn't feel like he's flourishing.

398.speaker: Astarion
398.text: Really? I suppose that's good to hear, after what we went through.
398.context: NodeContext: A little surprised - Astarion doesn't feel like he's flourishing.

278.speaker: Astarion
278.text: I am flattered you noticed! I have been doing rather well, actually. All things considered.

440.speaker: Player
440.text: Are we? Because looking at you, I'm not so sure.

62.speaker: Astarion
62.text: We've all faced challenges, I'm sure. Your loss of faith, my loss of... the sun.

382.speaker: Astarion
382.text: But the important thing is we survived. And for as long as we survive, we can thrive.

326.speaker: Astarion
326.text: You're looking well. It seems Grand Duking suits you.
326.context: NodeContext: Astarion tutting at the start, shaking his head.

415.speaker: Player
415.text: I'm just relieved no one minds the horns too much.
415.context: NodeContext: Astarion tutting at the start, shaking his head.

220.speaker: Astarion
220.text: Oh, you get used to them quickly enough. At this point you'd look strange without them.

11.speaker: Astarion
11.text: Besides, people care more about the good you've done than how you need your hats tailored.

78.speaker: Astarion
78.text: And you have done an awful lot of good, Wyll. During our time together and every day since then.

289.speaker: Player
289.text: It's a heavy burden, but a rewarding one. Rebuilding the city, helping it heal - it's been good.
289.context: NodeContext: Astarion tutting at the start, shaking his head.

149.speaker: Astarion
149.text: Yes, I've seen it. The city pulling together, under their new Grand Duke's leadership. You've been busy.

348.speaker: Player
348.text: I still have a lot to learn, but my father has been a helpful guide.
348.context: NodeContext: Astarion tutting at the start, shaking his head.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: I'm not sure. I still have a lot to learn.
21.context: NodeContext: Astarion tutting at the start, shaking his head.

124.speaker: Astarion
124.text: You're being modest, I see how you've rallied this city behind you - what you've done to restore its glory.

292.speaker: Player
292.text: It does! I was born for this.
292.context: NodeContext: Astarion tutting at the start, shaking his head.

182.speaker: Astarion
182.text: So it would seem - the city is flourishing. The good you've done is to be celebrated.

245.speaker: Player
245.text: For now. Although who knows when Mizora will tug on my leash again.
245.context: NodeContext: Astarion tutting at the start, shaking his head.

152.speaker: Astarion
152.text: Wyll, Wyll, Wyll. Have you learned nothing? That's a problem for tomorrow.
152.context: NodeContext: Astarion tutting at the start, shaking his head.

103.speaker: Astarion
103.text: Tonight, we are here, together, celebrating the good we've done.

354.speaker: Astarion
354.text: And you're straight from the Hells, if that whiff of brimstone can be trusted. How fares the Blade of Avernus?
354.context: NodeContext: (Previous line: "I wasn't sure our withered friend could live up to his promise [to bring us back together], but here we are.")

222.speaker: Player
222.text: Now that I'm free of my pact, I've made the Hells tremble.

186.speaker: Astarion
186.text: I don't doubt it. After the things you've done, there isn't an archdevil out there who isn't watching their back.

455.speaker: Player
455.text: The fight continues. Every devil I slay leaves Faerûn a little safer.

265.speaker: Astarion
265.text: That's a good war to fight, though a difficult one to win. There's always more evil out there, my friend.

4.speaker: Astarion
4.text: But let's not dwell on gloom - we've had enough of that already. Tonight is about celebrating past victories and toasting future triumphs.

238.speaker: Player
238.text: I've had to walk a delicate path, killing devils while keeping Mizora on my side.

408.speaker: Astarion
408.text: Yes, once someone like that gets their claws into you, there's only one sure way to get them out again. And it isn't pretty.

219.speaker: Player
219.text: I'm on a crusade against the Hells - it's as tough as it sounds.

227.speaker: Astarion
227.text: Though I admit, I'm surprised the Blade of Frontiers has the time to come mingle with us. If the stories are true, you've been saving lives and doing good all across the land.
227.context: NodeContext: (Previous line: "I wasn't sure our withered friend could live up to his promise [to bring us back together], but here we are.")

200.speaker: Player
200.text: The stories grow with each telling. The truth is more humble.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I'm doing what I can. No more or less than that.

128.speaker: Astarion
128.text: So modest after achieving so much? What's the point in being a hero if you just brush off the praise?

170.speaker: Astarion
170.text: Revel in it, Wyll. Let it wash over you - carry you away, even. It's a lot more fun.

405.speaker: Player
405.text: Are you worried? You are a monstrous vampire spawn, after all.

155.speaker: Astarion
155.text: Ha! No, I think anyone sporting your horns should know not to judge a person's form before their character.

223.speaker: Astarion
223.text: Ha! No, I've seen your journey. You're not one to judge on form over character. Not anymore at least.

424.speaker: Astarion
424.text: And I must say, for someone who had to face down a dark god, you seem to be doing remarkably well.
424.context: NodeContext: (Previous line: "I wasn't sure our withered friend could live up to his promise [to bring us back together], but here we are.")

272.speaker: Astarion
272.text: What have you been up to? No... relapses, I hope?
272.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion subtly slips his hand behind his back. (He's reaching for a dagger, just in case the Dark Urge is about to go feral and kill him, but we don't see the dagger until a later shot.)

1.text: No, the call of my blood is well and truly gone - whatever Withers did worked.
1.context: NodeContext: Second line - half to himself

99.speaker: Player
99.text: No, the call of my blood is well and truly gone - whatever Withers did worked.
99.context: NodeContext: Second line - half to himself

236.speaker: Astarion
236.text: I am pleased to hear it. For all our sakes.
236.context: NodeContext: Second line - half to himself

280.speaker: Astarion
280.text: Not that I was worried, of course - I knew you'd have this under control.
280.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot from behind, we can see Astarion was clutching a dagger behind his back.

458.speaker: Astarion
458.text: But I am glad to see you doing well. I'm glad to see us all doing well, in fact. Things turned out rather nicely in the end.
458.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion subtly puts away the dagger and both hands go back to their normal positions.

230.speaker: Player
230.text: I've found a calm life. Herbal tea, breathing exercises, stretches.
230.context: NodeContext: Third line - half to himself

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Researching Bhaalspawn. I want to know everything about Bhaal's taint - just in case.
81.context: NodeContext: Third line - half to himself

243.speaker: Astarion
243.text: Of course! A very sensible step. The last thing we wanted was another surprise.
243.context: NodeContext: Third line - half to himself

429.speaker: Player
429.context: NodeContext: The slightest touch of wariness in his voice

453.speaker: Astarion
453.text: Well, I am glad it's been going well.
453.context: NodeContext: The slightest touch of wariness in his voice

171.speaker: Astarion
171.text: And you're looking more delicious than ever, if you don't mind me saying.
171.context: NodeContext: (Previous line: "I wasn't sure our withered friend could live up to his promise [to bring us back together], but here we are.")

180.speaker: Astarion
180.text: Whatever you've been doing with your time, it's clearly worked wonders.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: You can thank my partner for that. Being with them has been a blessing.

226.speaker: Astarion
226.text: I do wonder what could have been between us, sometimes, but... well, that's dead and buried.

301.speaker: Player
301.text: You can thank my partner for that. Being with them has been a blessing.

391.speaker: Player
391.text: I've been living - seeing as much of the world as possible.

118.speaker: Astarion
118.text: You've become a traveller and a vagabond? A soul after my own heart.

100.speaker: Astarion
100.text: But I'm glad to see the world has treated you well - you've earned it. We both have, in fact.

16.speaker: Astarion
16.text: And where better to celebrate our good fortune? An old haunt with old friends.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: After everything, I wanted to keep helping people. I've been trying to make a difference.

244.speaker: Astarion
244.text: Ah, so it's the healthy glow you get from being a good person? That explains my pallor.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I've been boring - living a quiet, peaceful life.

206.speaker: Astarion
206.text: And fate let you get away with that? Not one improbable adventure landed on your doorstep? I'm impressed.

358.speaker: Player
358.text: You know me - it's been a wild few months.

198.speaker: Astarion
198.text: Of course! I'd be disappointed with anything less - you always brought a wonderful sense of fun to the world.

57.speaker: Astarion
57.text: Don't tell me you want to get back to the fight already? Relax, my love - enjoy yourself.

110.speaker: Astarion
110.text: Well, look who decided to turn up.
110.context: NodeContext: Low approval greeting (not hostile, but not overjoyed to see you either.)

237.speaker: Astarion
237.text: After everything, this feels nice - a chance to take a breath... Metaphorically speaking.

251.speaker: Astarion
251.text: Gods, this is nice. Fresh air, no hordes of demons trying to kill us - this plane does have its benefits.
251.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Almost muttering to himself - he's annoyed at the player and doesn't want to speak to them again.

127.speaker: Astarion
127.text: So, how are you doing? Your engine isn't giving you any trouble?

305.speaker: Player
305.text: I'm good - it's so nice to see everyone!

435.speaker: Astarion
435.text: I'm glad you're having a good time, my love. It's a night to be savoured.

332.speaker: Player
332.text: I just wish we didn't have to go back.

439.speaker: Astarion
439.text: I know, you start to forget what peace feels like. Best savour this time while we can.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: Engine's fine. I'll make it through tonight, but tomorrow would be pushing it.

359.speaker: Astarion
359.text: I doubt tomorrow is on the cards, alas. But we can still enjoy tonight.

423.speaker: Astarion
423.text: How have our friends fared without us? Falling apart, I assume?

260.speaker: Astarion
260.text: I'm flattered by the attention, darling, but don't you want to check in with some of our erstwhile companions? I'm sure they've missed you.
260.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Almost muttering to himself - he's annoyed at the player and doesn't want to speak to them again.

393.speaker: Astarion
393.text: By the gods, this evening can't end soon enough.
393.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn] Almost muttering to himself - he's annoyed at the player and doesn't want to speak to them again.
